title: When was the last solar eclipse during an important battle? - Quora

response.answer_text: On Jan. 22, 1879, a numerically superior Zulu force were overwhelmed by a smaller but more advanced British contingent. By coincidence, an annular solar eclipse occurred around 2:30 p.m. at the tail end of the battle. The event would have been seen as a deep partial eclipse from the battlefield, and the reduction in sunlight would have been noticable. The name of the battle became known as “Isandlwana” which in Zulu means “the day of the dead moon.”
